attributes.attribute: Indicator of whether the participant is healthy and obese using the strict metabolic syndrome criteria. To be considered as healthy obese the participant must have a BMI of more than 30 and not show any metabolic syndromes (using the strict criteria) or have a diagnosis of any targeted cariadovascular diseases, diabetes, or hypertension.

Indicator of whether the participant is healthy and obese using the moderate metabolic syndrome criteria. To be considered as healthy obese the participant must have a BMI of more than 30 and not show any metabolic syndromes (using the moderate criteria) or have a diagnosis of any targeted cariadovascular diseases, diabetes, or hypertension.
Body Mass Index calculated using measured weight and height (Mass in Kg / (Height in M)2).
The vertical measurement or distance from the foot to the head of the participant when he/she is standing. Must be measured and not self-reported. Unit: cm
Weight of the participant. Must be measured and not self-reported. Unit: Kg
Number of targeted metabolic syndromes (strict criteria)

The number of metabolic syndromes present in the participant using strict criteria (i.e. (1) Blood pressure ≥ 130 mmHg systolic, or ≥85 mmHg diastolic, or treatment for elevated BP; (2) Fasting blood glucose ≥ 6.1, or medical treatment for diabetes; (3) HDL cholesterol < 1.03 mmol/l (men) or < 1.30 mmol/l (women) - in non-SI units: < 40 mg/dl (men) or < 50 mg/dl (women); (4) Triglycerides ≥ 1.7 mmol/l (≥ 150 mg/dl), or on medication for elevated triglycerides.
Number of targeted metabolic syndromes (moderate criteria)

The number of metabolic syndromes present in the participant using moderate criteria (i.e. (1) Blood pressure ≥ 140 mmHg systolic, or ≥90 mmHg diastolic, or treatment for elevated BP; (2) Fasting blood glucose ≥ 7, or medical treatment for diabetes; (3) HDL cholesterol < 1.03 mmol/l (men) or < 1.30 mmol/l (women) - in non-SI units: < 40 mg/dl (men) or < 50 mg/dl (women); (4) Triglycerides ≥ 1.7 mmol/l (≥ 150 mg/dl), or on medication for elevated triglycerides.
Laboratory measurement of fasting glucose. Unit mmol/L
Laboratory measurement of total serum cholesterol. Unit: mmol/L
Laboratory measurement of triglycerides. Unit: mmol/L

Occurence of stroke at any point during the life of the participant. Can be collected using an assessment item asking about the history of stroke or from a list of disease history using ICD-10 Codes I60-I69 (Please make a note to indicate which coding is used for diagnosis if other than ICD-10)

Occurrence of diabetes at any point during the life of the participant (not including gestational). Can be collected using an assessment item asking about the history of diabetes specifically, or from a list of disease history using ICD-10 Codes E10-E16 (Please make a note to indicate which coding is used for diagnosis if other than ICD-10)
Type of diabetes diagnosed. Whether the participant had type 1, type 2, or gestational diabetes.

Occurrence of high blood pressure at any point during the life of the participant. Can be collected using an assessment item asking about the history of hypertension specifically, or from a list of disease history using ICD-10 Codes I10-I15 (Please make a note to indicate which coding is used for diagnosis if other than ICD-10)

Occurrence of myocardial infarction at any point during the life of the participant. Can be collected using an assessment item asking abour myocardial infarction or heart attack or from a list of disease history using ICD-10 Codes I20-I22 (Please make a note to indicate which coding is used for diagnosis if other than ICD-10)
Current Use of Antihypertensive Medication (from categorical assessment item)
Indicator of whether the participant currently uses antihypertensive medication. Self-reported by a question targeting the use of antihypertensive medication.
Current Use of Antihypertensive Medication (from medication list)

Indicator of whether the participant currently uses antihypertensive medication. Extracted from a list of medication using the following ATC Codes or equivalent in other classifications: C02, C03, C04, C07, C08, C09
Current Use of Glucose Lowering Medication (from categorical assessment item)
Indicator of whether the participant currently uses glucose lowering medication. Self-reported by a question targeting the use of glucose lowering medication or medication to treat diabetes.
Not currently using glucose lowering medication
UNDER DEVELOPMENT Average annual income, after taxes deduction, of the participant's entire household (in Euros). Phase 2 variable
Number of people who live with the participant in the same household (including the participant). Phase 2 variable
Number of People in the Household (Phase 2)

Indicator of whether the participant completed at least some elements of post-secondary (non-tertiary) education using UNESCO Revision of the International Standard Classification of Education, 2011 (ISCED-2011; http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/Documents/UNESCO_GC_36C-19_ISCED_EN.pdf). Educational programmes classified as "post-secondary non-tertiary" are not considered as tertiary education and are typically vocational and terminal programmes that prepare for the labour market. They are referred to in many ways across the world and encompass technician diplomas, primary professional education, post-secondary non-tertiary vocational, and préparation aux carrières administratives. For international comparability purposes the term “post-secondary non-tertiary” is used. Phase 2 variable
Some Elements of Post-Secondary Non-Tertiary Education Completed (Phase 2)
At least some elements of post-secondary education completed

Indicator of whether the participant completed at least some elements of tertiary education using UNESCO Revision of the International Standard Classification of Education, 2011 (ISCED-2011; http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/Documents/UNESCO_GC_36C-19_ISCED_EN.pdf). Here, "tertiary education" combines levels 5 through 8 of ISCED (Short-cycle tertiary, Bachelor or equivalent, Master or equivalent, Doctoral or equivalent). Educational programmes classified as "tertiary education" are referred to in many ways across the world, and encompass master craftsman programme, (higher) technical education, community college education, technician or advanced/higher vocational training, associate degree, bachelor programme, licence, first university cycle, master programmes, magister, PhD, DPhil, D.Lit, D.Sc, LL.D, and Doctorate. For international comparability purposes the term “tertiary” is used. Phase 2 variable
Some Elements of Tertiary Education Completed (Phase 2)
Did not complete first stage of tertiary education
At least first stage of tertiary education

Indicator of whether the participant completed at least some elements of secondary education/second stage of basic education using UNESCO Revision of the International Standard Classification of Education, 2011 (ISCED-2011; http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/Documents/UNESCO_GC_36C-19_ISCED_EN.pdf). Here, "secondary education" combines levels 2 and 3 of ISCED (Lower and Upper Secondary). Educational programmes classified as "secondary education" are referred to in many ways across the world and encompass secondary school (upper and lower grades), junior/senior secondary school, middle school, junior high school, and high school. For international comparability purposes the term “secondary education” is used. Phase 2 variable

Indicator of whether the participant completed at least some elements of primary education using UNESCO Revision of the International Standard Classification of Education, 2011 (ISCED-2011; http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/Documents/UNESCO_GC_36C-19_ISCED_EN.pdf). Educational programmes classified as "primary education" are referred to in many ways across the world, and encompass elementary education and basic education (stage 1/lower grades). For international comparability purposes the term “primary” is used. Phase 2 variable

Participant's current job title based on the International Standard Classification of Occupations (ISCO-88; http://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco88/index.htm).The ten major groups at the top level of the ISCO-88 are used to classify occupations. Phase 2 variable
Service workers and shop and maket sales workers
Plant and machine operators and assemblers
Indicator of whether the participant has ever had paid employement or been self employed. Phase 2 variable
Indicator of whether the participant is currently a student. Phase 2 variable
Average number of working hours of the participant per week. Phase 2 variable
Number of Working Hours of the Participant on Average in a Typical Week (Phase 2)
Current Quantity of Total Alcohol Consumed in Wine, Beer and Liquors per week (Phase 2)

UNDER DEVELOPMENT Milligrams of alcohol consumed on average per week. Current quantity of total alcohol taken = (Current quantity of wine taken * Average quantity of alcohol in a glass (size) of red wine) + (Current quantity of beer taken * Average quantity of alcohol in a bottle (size) of beer) + (Current quantity of liquor taken * Average quantity of alcohol in a measure (size) of liquor). Phase 2 variable
Indicator of whether the participant is currently in paid employment or is self-employed. Phase 2 variable
No paid employment or not self-employed
Indicator of whether the participant is currently retired. Phase 2 variable
Married and/or living with a partner
Indicator of whether the participant currently smokes cigarettes. Current is defined as today and up to the last 12 months. Phase 2 variable
Current average number of cigarettes smoked per week. Current is defined as today and up to the last 12 months. Phase 2 variable
Indicator of whether the participant has ever smoked tobacco. Phase 2 variable
Indicator of whether the participant is currently living with a spouse or a partner in a common household. Phase 2 variable
Not currently living with a spouse or a partner
Currently living with a spouse or a partner
Indicator of whether the participant has ever smoked cigarettes. Phase 2 variable
Current Use of Lipid Lowering Medication (from categorical assessment item)
Indicator of whether the participant currently uses lipid lowering medication. Self-reported by a question targeting the use of lipid lowering medication.
Not currently using lipid lowering medication
Current Use of Glucose Lowering Medication (from medication list)
Indicator of whether the participant currently uses glucose lowering medication. Extracted from a list of medication using the following ATC Codes or equivalent in other classifications: A10
Not currently using glucose lowering medication
Current Use of Lipid Lowering Medication (from medication list)
Indicator of whether the participant currently uses lipid lowering medication. Extracted from a list of medication using the following ATC Codes or equivalent in other classifications: C10
Not currently using lipid lowering medication
Country where the participant currently lives.
Measured distance around the hips. Unit: cm
Country where the participant was born reclassified into seven categories using United Nations macro geographical regions, and subregions. (http://unstats.un.org/unsd/methods/m49/m49regin.htm)
Measured diastolic blood pressure. Participant must be at rest when measurement is taken. Unit: mmHg
Region (province, state, territory, etc.) where the participant currently lives.
Indicator of whether the participant currently smokes tobacco. Includes use of cigarettes, cigars, pipes and other tobacco products.
Indicator of whether the participant ever consumed alcohol. Phase 2 variable
Average number of drinks of liquor/spirits consumed by the participant per week. Phase 2 variable
Average number of beers consumed by the participant per week. Phase 2 variable
Indicator of whether the participant currently consumes alcohol. Phase 2 variable
Measured systolic blood pressure. Participant must be at rest when measurement is taken. Unit: mmHg
Measured distance around the waist. Unit:cm
Current Use of Lipid Lowering Medications Fibrates and/or Nicotinic Acid Derivatives (from medication list)

Indicator of whether the participant currently uses the lipid lowering medications fibrates and/or nicotinic acid derivatives. Extracted from a list of medication using the following ATC Codes or equivalent in other classifications: C10AB and C10AD.
Not currently using Lipid Lowering Medications Fibrates and/or Nicotinic Acid Derivatives
Currently using Lipid Lowering Medications Fibrates and/or Nicotinic Acid Derivatives
Average number of glasses of wine (including red and white wine) consumed by the participant per week. Phase 2 variable
Laboratory measurement of HDL cholesterol. Unit: mmol/L
Body Mass Index calculated using measured weight and and height (Mass in Kg / (Height in M)2) and stratified in 3 categories.
Number of years of education of the participant throughout his/her life. Based on the education system of each members cohort.
Laboratory measurement of creatinin. Unit: mmol/L
Last Job Title Prior to Retirement (ISCO-88) Phase 2
Title of the last job the participant had prior to retirement based on ISCO-88 classification.
Service workers and shop and market sales workers
Plant and machine operators and assemblers
Adjusted Glucose (bridges fasting and non-fasting glucose) Phase 2
Laboratory measurement of non-fasting glucose. Unit mmol/L
Laboratory measurment of High-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP). Unit mmol/L
Laboratory measurement of microalbuminuria. Unit mmol/L
Indicator of whether the participant currently smokes cigars. Current is defined as today and up to the last 12 months. Phase 2 variable
Indicator of whether the participant currently smokes pipes. Current is defined as today and up to the last 12 months. Phase 2 Variable.
Current Quantity of Total Tobacco Consumed in Cigarettes, Cigarillos and Cigars. (Phase2)

Grams of tobacco consumed on average per day by the participant. The total amount of tobacco in g/day was calculated by summing daily tobacco usage in grams of cigarettes, cigarillos and cigars. To note, 1 cigarette= 1 gram of tobacco, 1 cigarillo=3 grams tobacco and 1 cigar= 5 grams tobacco.

Under Development Current quantity of total tobacco consumed per day of cigarettes, cigarillos and cigars grouped into three levels.: light smoker, moderate smoker and heavy smoker. Note, 1 cigarette= 1 gram tobacco, 1 cigarillo= 3 grams tobacco and 1 cigar=5 grams tobacco. Also, light smoker is defined as less than 10g/day, moderate smoker as >=15 g/day and heavy as 20 or more g/day.
UNDER DEVELOPMENT. Participants lifetime exposure to tobacco.
Gravidity (total number of times a female participant has been pregnant) Phase 2
Total number of times a female particpant has been pregnant
Number of living births a female participant has had.
